cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.GT, cs.DM, cs.CC. 

The problem of computing induced subgraphs is a fundamental topic in graph algorithms, which is studied in various subfields of computer science. The focus of this paper is on the Balanced Connected Subgraph problem, which involves finding a connected subgraph that satisfies certain color-balancing constraints. This problem is related to topics such as graph theory, combinatorial optimization, and computational geometry. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories for this paper are cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.CG (Computational Geometry), and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory). Additionally, since the paper involves proving NP-hardness and designing polynomial time algorithms, it may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
